title: Revise skills to match Anthropic best practices
description:
## Problem
20 skills audited against Anthropic's Complete Guide to Building Skills. 2 have broken filenames (invisible to Claude), writing-skills missing key rules, several descriptions lack WHAT+WHEN format, references to nonexistent skills.

## Solution
Targeted fixes in 6 phases: filename fixes, writing-skills update, broken references, description quality, cleanup, progressive disclosure.

## Success Criteria
- All SKILL.md files correctly cased
- writing-skills covers all guide rules
- No references to nonexistent skills
- All descriptions follow WHAT + WHEN + triggers format
- Redundant frontmatter removed, allowed-tools normalized
- Long skills use references/ for progressive disclosure

title: Update writing-skills with missing Anthropic guide rules
description:
## Context
Epic: .claude-08g — Revise skills to match Anthropic best practices

## Files
- Modify: skills/writing-skills/SKILL.md

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Covers no claude/anthropic naming restriction
- [ ] Covers no XML in frontmatter restriction
- [ ] Covers no README.md in skill folder rule
- [ ] Covers <1024 char description limit
- [ ] Description guidance updated to WHAT + WHEN (not ONLY triggers)
- [ ] Standard dirs (references/, assets/) documented
- [ ] Progressive disclosure 3-level model mentioned
- [ ] Existing TDD methodology preserved unchanged

## Implementation

### Edit 1: Add naming + frontmatter restrictions to Frontmatter section
After the frontmatter code block (line 61 closing ```), before the field table:

old_string:
```
| Field | Effect |
|-------|--------|
| `disable-model-invocation: true` | User-only |
| `user-invocable: false` | Claude-only |
| `context: fork` | Isolated subagent |
```

new_string:
```
**Restrictions:**
- Name must NOT contain "claude" or "anthropic"
- No XML tags in frontmatter values
- Description must be <1024 characters

| Field | Effect |
|-------|--------|
| `disable-model-invocation: true` | User-only |
| `user-invocable: false` | Claude-only |
| `context: fork` | Isolated subagent |
```

### Edit 2: Add references/ and assets/ to directory structure, add README.md prohibition
old_string:
```
skills/
  skill-name/
    SKILL.md              # Main reference (required)
    template.md           # Template
    examples/             # Example outputs
    scripts/              # Utilities
```

new_string:
```
skills/
  skill-name/
    SKILL.md              # Main reference (required)
    template.md           # Template
    examples/             # Example outputs
    references/           # Heavy reference material
    assets/               # Static assets
    scripts/              # Utilities
```

Note: Never add README.md to skill folders — SKILL.md is the entry point.

### Edit 3: Update description guidance from "ONLY triggers" to "WHAT + WHEN"
old_string:
```
## Description Field (Critical)

**ONLY triggers. NEVER workflow summary.**

```yaml
# BAD: Claude shortcuts instead of reading skill
description: Use when executing plans - dispatches subagent per task with review

# GOOD: Just triggers
description: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks
```

**Why:** Claude shortcuts workflow summaries, skips actual content.
```

new_string:
```
## Description Field (Critical)

**WHAT it does + WHEN to use. NEVER workflow details.**

Must be <1024 characters. Tells Claude what the skill does and when to
invoke it — but not HOW it works internally.

```yaml
# BAD: workflow details Claude will shortcut
description: Use when executing plans - dispatches subagent per task with review

# GOOD: what + when
description: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks
```

**Why:** Claude shortcuts workflow summaries, skips actual content.
```

### Edit 4: Add progressive disclosure guidance to SKILL.md Structure section
old_string:
```
## Common Mistakes
What fails + fixes.
```
```

new_string:
```
## Common Mistakes
What fails + fixes.
```

**Progressive disclosure:** Structure content in 3 levels:
1. **Critical** — must-know rules (## Critical header)
2. **Important** — common patterns (## Important header)
3. **Reference** — lookup tables, edge cases

Use `## Critical` / `## Important` headers so Claude prioritizes
correctly under token pressure.
```

title: Remove references to nonexistent skills in debugging and implement
description:
## Context
Epic: .claude-08g — Revise skills to match Anthropic best practices

## Files
- Modify: skills/debugging/SKILL.md
- Modify: skills/implement/SKILL.md

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] No references to nonexistent skills remain
- [ ] Behavior preserved (inlined or removed gracefully)
- [ ] No broken skill dispatch calls

## Implementation

### 1. debugging/SKILL.md — Remove `team-debug` references

**Replace line 33** (Phase 3, step 2):
```
old: 2. **If you identify 3+ plausible hypotheses:** STOP — invoke `Skill tool: team-debug` with bug description + hypotheses. Don't continue single-thread debugging.
new: 2. **If you identify 3+ plausible hypotheses:** STOP — spawn parallel subagents (one per hypothesis) to investigate simultaneously. Each subagent traces one hypothesis, reports evidence for/against.
```

**Replace line 36** (Phase 3, step 5 parenthetical):
```
old: 5. Worked → Phase 4. Didn't → NEW hypothesis (if this is your 3rd hypothesis, escalate per step 2)
new: 5. Worked → Phase 4. Didn't → NEW hypothesis (if this is your 3rd hypothesis, parallelize per step 2)
```

**Replace line 40** (Phase 4, step 1):
```
old: 1. Create failing test - use Skill tool to invoke `tdd`
new: 1. Create failing test that reproduces the bug
```

**Replace lines 58-65** (Skill Composition table — remove entirely, all three entries reference nonexistent skills):
```
old:
## Skill Composition

| When | Invoke |
|------|--------|
| Writing tests | `use Skill tool to invoke tdd` |
| Verifying fix | `use Skill tool to invoke verification-before-completion` |
| 3+ plausible root causes | `use Skill tool to invoke team-debug` |

new: (delete entirely — behavior is now inlined in phases above)
```

### 2. implement/SKILL.md — Remove `finishing-branch` references

**Replace line 61** (Solo Mode, step 6):
```
old: 6. Done → invoke finishing-branch skill
new: 6. Done → `bd sync` + report completion to caller
```

**Replace line 140** (Swarm Teardown, step 3):
```
old: 3. Invoke finishing-branch skill
new: 3. `bd sync` + report completion to caller
```

- [ ] No XML tags

```
description: Use when compressing text for AI consumption - skill files, system prompts, agent instructions. Not for human docs.
```

**New:**

description: Compress text for AI consumption — skill files, system prompts, agent instructions. Triggers: "compress", "reduce tokens", "shrink prompt", "make it shorter for AI". Not for human docs.
```

### 2. git-surgeon/SKILL.md

**Old:**
```
description: Non-interactive hunk-level git staging, unstaging, discarding, undoing, fixup, and commit splitting. Use when selectively staging, unstaging, discarding, reverting, or splitting individual diff hunks by ID instead of interactively. Also use when asked to commit changes separately, make separate commits, or split changes into multiple commits.
```

**New:**
```
description: Non-interactive hunk-level git operations — stage, unstage, discard, undo, fixup, and split by hunk ID. Triggers: "stage this hunk", "split commit", "partial stage", "discard hunk", "selective staging", "commit separately", "separate commits".
```

### 3. graphite/SKILL.md

**Old:**
```
description: Graphite stacked PRs - create, sync, modify, submit. Auto-triggers on gt commands, "stack", "branch", "PR", "push", "submit".
```

**New:**
```
description: Manage Graphite stacked PRs — create, sync, modify, submit branches and PRs. Triggers: gt commands, "stack", "branch", "PR", "push", "submit".
```

### 4. reference-sync/SKILL.md

**Old:**
```
description: "Sync references/ submodule and analyze changes since last update"
```

**New:**
```
description: "Sync references/ submodule and analyze upstream changes since last update. Triggers: \"reference sync\", \"check references\", \"update references\", \"what changed upstream\"."
```

### 5. implement/SKILL.md

**Old:**
```
description: "Triggers: 'invoke implement', 'implement with arg', beads issue/epic ID, 'execute the plan', 'build this', 'code this plan', 'start implementing', 'now implement', 'time to implement', 'ready to implement', 'begin implementation', 'let me implement', 'To continue: use Skill tool to invoke implement'. Extract issue-id from 'with arg X'."
```

**New:**
```
description: "Execute a beads epic or task — auto-detects solo vs swarm mode, dispatches subagents to implement. Triggers: \"implement\", \"execute the plan\", \"build this\", \"code this plan\", \"start implementing\", \"ready to implement\", beads issue/epic ID."

### 3. Normalize allowed-tools wildcard syntax to `Bash(cmd:*)`
Files using space syntax that need colon:
- **pr-description/SKILL.md**: change all `Bash(cmd *)` to `Bash(cmd:*)`
  - `Bash(git status *)` → `Bash(git status:*)`
  - `Bash(git diff *)` → `Bash(git diff:*)`
  - `Bash(git log *)` → `Bash(git log:*)`
  - `Bash(git branch *)` → `Bash(git branch:*)`
  - `Bash(git show *)` → `Bash(git show:*)`
  - `Bash(gh pr view *)` → `Bash(gh pr view:*)`
  - `Bash(gh pr edit *)` → `Bash(gh pr edit:*)`
  - `Bash(gt log *)` → `Bash(gt log:*)`
- **graphite/SKILL.md**: `Bash(gt *)` already uses space — change to `Bash(gt:*)`

### 4. Add error handling to start/SKILL.md
After step 6, add:
```
## Error Handling
- `gt create` fails → check if branch exists (`git branch -a | grep <name>`), suggest alternate name
- `bd update` fails → verify issue ID exists with `bd show <id>`, report if missing
- Not on expected parent branch → warn user, suggest `gt checkout` first
```

### 5. Add error handling to fix/SKILL.md
After step 3 (Report), add:
```
## Error Handling
- No beads CLI → tell user to install, stop
- `bd create` fails → show error, retry once, then report
- Ambiguous feedback → AskUserQuestion for clarification before creating issues
```

### 6. Add error handling to reference-sync/SKILL.md
After Key Constraints section, add:
```
## Error Handling
- No `references/` directory → "Submodule not initialized. Run: `git submodule update --init`"
- `git fetch` fails → check network, report and stop
- Subagent fails on area → report which area failed, continue with others
```

### 7. Add error handling to prepare/SKILL.md
After step 8 (Report), add:
```
## Error Handling
- No design field content → "Run `/explore` first to generate a design", stop
- `bd create` fails for epic → check beads CLI available, report error
- Subagent fails on phase → report which phase, continue others, note gap in report
- `bd swarm validate` fails → show validation errors, ask user how to proceed
```

title: Move detailed content to references/ for review and pr-reviewers
description:
## Context
Epic: .claude-08g — Revise skills to match Anthropic best practices

Two skills exceed ideal length. Move detailed reference content to
references/ subdirectories following 3-level progressive disclosure:
frontmatter (always loaded) → SKILL.md body (on invoke) → linked files
(navigated on demand).

## Files
- Modify: skills/review/SKILL.md (trim from 201 → ~110 lines)
- Create: skills/review/references/prompts.md (reviewer prompt templates)
- Modify: skills/pr-reviewers/SKILL.md (trim from 111 → ~70 lines)
- Create: skills/pr-reviewers/references/scoring.md (scoring algorithm)

## review/SKILL.md — What Moves

Move lines 67–102 (Solo Mode lens prompts) and lines 112–146
(Perspective Mode prompts) and lines 171–185 (fix dispatch prompt)
to `references/prompts.md`.

Replace each block with a single instruction line:
```
Read references/prompts.md for <section> prompt templates.
```

Keep: mode selection logic, step structure, consolidation rules,
output format, receiving feedback section.

### references/prompts.md content

```markdown
# Reviewer Prompt Templates

## Solo Mode

### Lens 1: Correctness & Security
\`\`\`
You are an adversarial correctness and security reviewer.

{diff + full file contents}

Focus:
- Edge cases (empty, null, overflow, concurrent access)
- Invalid states, race conditions
- Resource leaks (unclosed handles, missing cleanup)
- Silent failures, swallowed errors
- Off-by-one, logic inversions
- Injection (SQL, command, XSS, template)
- Auth/authz gaps, data exposure, cryptographic misuse

Output: table with Severity | File:Line | Issue | Suggestion
Then brief summary.
\`\`\`

### Lens 2: Architecture & Performance
\`\`\`
You are an adversarial architecture and performance reviewer.

{diff + full file contents}

Focus:
- Incomplete refactors, dead code, unused params
- Unnecessary abstractions, coupling
- Could this be simpler?
- O(n^2) in loops, unnecessary allocations
- Memory (retained refs, unbounded growth)
- I/O (blocking calls, N+1 queries)
- Concurrency (thread safety, deadlock, contention)

Output: table with Severity | File:Line | Issue | Suggestion
Then brief summary.
\`\`\`

## Perspective Mode (--team)

### Perspective 1: Architect (model: opus)
\`\`\`
Architecture reviewer. Focus:
- System boundaries, coupling, scalability
- Design flaws, incomplete abstractions
- Dependency direction, module cohesion
- Could this be simpler or more maintainable?

Tag: [architect]
Output: Phase 1 (Critical) → Phase 2 (Design) → Phase 3 (Testing Gaps)
\`\`\`

### Perspective 2: Code Quality (model: sonnet)
\`\`\`
Code quality reviewer. Focus:
- Readability, naming, error handling
- Edge cases, off-by-one, null safety
- Consistency with surrounding code
- Resource leaks, missing cleanup

Tag: [code-quality]
Output: Phase 1 (Critical) → Phase 2 (Design) → Phase 3 (Testing Gaps)
\`\`\`

### Perspective 3: Devil's Advocate (model: opus)
\`\`\`
Devil's advocate reviewer. Focus:
- Failure modes others miss
- Security: injection, auth gaps, data exposure
- Bad assumptions, race conditions
- What breaks under load, bad input, or partial failure?

Tag: [devil]
Output: Phase 1 (Critical) → Phase 2 (Design) → Phase 3 (Testing Gaps)
\`\`\`

## Fix Dispatch Prompt (model: sonnet)
\`\`\`
Fix these review issues in code.

## Issues to Fix
{issues with file:line refs}

## Your Job
1. Fix each listed issue
2. Verify fixes (syntax check, tests if quick)
3. Report what you fixed

Do NOT: fix unlisted things, refactor beyond needed, add features
\`\`\`
```

## pr-reviewers/SKILL.md — What Moves

Move lines 46–75 (candidate gathering git commands) and lines 79–96
(scoring weights + penalties tables) to `references/scoring.md`.

Replace with:
```
Read references/scoring.md for candidate gathering commands, scoring
weights, and penalty multipliers.
```

Keep: steps overview, generated file exclusion list, presentation
rules, "never say reviewed your PRs" rule.

### references/scoring.md content

```markdown
# Scoring Algorithm

## Candidate Gathering Commands

**For existing files** — use `git log` not `git blame` (faster):
\`\`\`
git log --since="12 months ago" --format='%aN <%aE>' --diff-filter=M -- <files> | sort | uniq -c | sort -rn
\`\`\`

**For new files** — find experts on parent directory:
\`\`\`
git log --since="12 months ago" --format='%aN <%aE>' -- <parent_dirs> | sort | uniq -c | sort -rn
\`\`\`

**Line-weighted ownership** (for top candidates only, not all files):
\`\`\`
git log --since="12 months ago" --numstat --format='%aN' -- <files>
\`\`\`
Sum lines touched per author. Normalize: `author_lines / total_lines`.

**Recent reviewers** (for PENALTY):
\`\`\`
gh pr list --author @me --state merged --limit 10 --json reviews
\`\`\`

**Current review load**:
\`\`\`
gh api graphql -f query='{ search(query:"is:pr is:open review-requested:<username>", type:ISSUE) { issueCount } }'
\`\`\`

**CODEOWNERS**: check `.github/CODEOWNERS` or `CODEOWNERS`.
Skip if absent — don't error.

## Scoring Weights

| Factor | Weight | Normalization |
|--------|--------|---------------|
| Line-weighted ownership | 40% | `author_lines / total_lines` across changed files |
| Recent commit count | 30% | `author_commits / max_commits` among candidates |
| CODEOWNERS match | 15% | 1.0 if matched, 0.0 if not (skip if no file) |
| Directory familiarity (new files) | 15% | `dir_commits / max_dir_commits` |

## Penalties (multiply final score)

| Condition | Multiplier |
|-----------|------------|
| Reviewed 3+ of last 5 author PRs | ×0.7 |
| Reviewed 2 of last 5 author PRs | ×0.85 |
| 5+ open review requests | ×0.8 |
| 8+ open review requests | ×0.6 |
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] review/SKILL.md under 120 lines with references/ link
- [ ] review/references/prompts.md contains all prompt templates verbatim
- [ ] pr-reviewers/SKILL.md under 80 lines with references/ link
- [ ] pr-reviewers/references/scoring.md contains scoring algorithm verbatim
- [ ] Skills still function correctly (orchestration logic intact in SKILL.md)
- [ ] No content lost — moved content preserved exactly

title: Explore: pr-fix-comments skill for dot-claude repo
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- Findings stored in bead design field
- Structured as Current State, Recommendation, and phased Next Steps
- Each phase includes file paths and is independently actionable
design:
## Current State

**Deleted from dot-claude** in commit 0b0a142 (Feb 11) as "superseded skills".

**Upstream version** (repo-local):
- Uses `uv run` + custom arg parsing library
- Hardcoded repo name
- Uses `git push` (breaks Graphite)
- Missing `gt` from allowed-tools
- Combines "commit, push, resolve" into one step

**Old dot-claude version** (deleted):
- Used `python3` + standard `argparse`
- Repo-agnostic (auto-detected via `gh repo view`)
- Used `gt ss --update-only` correctly

## Recommendation

New skill in `~/.claude/skills/pr-fix-comments/` that:
1. Repo-agnostic script (auto-detect via `gh repo view`)
2. Standard python3 + argparse (no external deps)
3. Two-phase confirmation: commit (ask) → push separately (ask)
4. Uses `gt ss --update-only` not `git push`
5. Never auto-pushes

## Key Files

Create:
- `~/.claude/skills/pr-fix-comments/skill.md`
- `~/.claude/skills/pr-fix-comments/scripts/pr_threads.py`

## Risks

- `gh repo view` fails without git remote
- `gt ss` fails if stack has conflicts
- Thread resolution on draft PRs may differ

## Next Steps

**Phase 1: Skill prompt** (`skill.md`)
**Phase 2: Script** (`pr_threads.py`)
**Phase 3: Validate**

## Implementation

### Step 1: Create skill.md

```markdown
---
name: pr-fix-comments
description: "Fix unresolved PR review comments. Triggers: 'fix comments', 'fix PR comments', 'address review feedback'."
user-invocable: true
allowed-tools:
  - "Bash(python3 ~/.claude/skills/pr-fix-comments/scripts/pr_threads.py *)"
  - "Bash(gh pr view *)"
  - "Bash(gh pr list *)"
  - "Bash(git branch --show-current)"
  - "Bash(git add *)"
  - "Bash(gt *)"
  - Read
  - Edit
  - Glob
  - Grep
---

# PR Comments Fixer

Fix unresolved review comments from a PR.

**Safety: NEVER auto-pushes. Push optional + requires confirmation.**

## Steps

1. **Detect PR**: `gh pr view --json number -q '.number'` or ask user

2. **Verify branch** (if PR specified manually):
   - `git branch --show-current` vs `gh pr view <PR> --json headRefName -q .headRefName`
   - Mismatch → ask user

3. **Fetch and display comments**:

   ```bash
   python3 ~/.claude/skills/pr-fix-comments/scripts/pr_threads.py fetch --pr <PR>
   ```

   Display as numbered list with file:line, author, preview.
   Ask "Which comment(s) to fix?" with options: "Fix all" / "Other"

4. **Plan fixes**: For each comment, read code, create one-line fix description.
   Ask "Ready to execute?"

5. **Execute**: Apply fixes, summarize changes.

6. **Commit**: Use `Skill tool: commit` to generate message and commit.

7. **Push** (optional): Ask first, then `gt ss --update-only`

8. **Resolve threads**: Show planned replies, ask confirmation, then:

   ```bash
   python3 ~/.claude/skills/pr-fix-comments/scripts/pr_threads.py reply --pr <PR> --comment-id <ID> --body "<message>"
   python3 ~/.claude/skills/pr-fix-comments/scripts/pr_threads.py resolve --thread-id <THREAD_ID>
   ```

   Reply format:
   - Exact fix: "Done [pr-fix-comments]"
   - Custom fix: "{brief explanation} [pr-fix-comments]"

## Notes

- User confirms plan before execution
- NEVER post thread replies without showing user first
- Be concise — don't over-explain trivial fixes
```

## Current State

**Location**: Upstream repo-local skill (not in dot-claude).

**Flow**:
1. Check git state (on branch, has commits)
2. Get diff via `git diff origin/main...HEAD`
3. LLM generates title + body from diff
4. Offers to create/update PR

**Problem**: Title generation uses generic LLM patterns, ignores conventional commit format from commit skill.

## Recommendation

Single-file skill at `~/.claude/skills/pr-description/skill.md` that:
1. Embeds conventional commit title format rules (same as commit skill)
2. Generates WHY-focused body
3. Assumes existing PR — update only
4. Never auto-submits — preview + confirm

## Risks

- Conventions drift if commit skill changes (low risk — format is stable)
- Stacked PRs: diff should be vs stack parent, not main

design:
## Skills Audit Against Anthropic Best Practices Guide

### Current State
20 skills found. 18 correct `SKILL.md`, 2 broken (`skill.md`). Generally high quality with consistent internal style. Main systemic issues: 2 wrong filenames, description gaps, missing structural rules in writing-skills, references to nonexistent skills.

### Writing-Skills Verdict
Teaches good TDD methodology for skill creation (keep this). But has material gaps:
- Missing rules: no claude/anthropic names, no XML in frontmatter, no README.md, <1024 char limit
- Description guidance contradicts guide: says "ONLY triggers" but guide requires WHAT + WHEN
- Missing standard dirs: references/, assets/
- Missing progressive disclosure 3-level model explanation

### Per-Skill Grades
A: refine, pr-reviewers
A-: commit, explore, graphite, prepare, resume-work, review, pr-description (content), pr-fix-comments (content), pr-fix-gha
B+: compress-prompt, debugging, implement, split-commit, start
B: fix, git-surgeon, reference-sync
F (discoverability): pr-description, pr-fix-comments (wrong filename)

### Phases
**Phase 1: Critical filename fixes**
Files: pr-description/skill.md, pr-fix-comments/skill.md
Two-step git mv for case-insensitive FS

**Phase 2: Update writing-skills**
Files: writing-skills/SKILL.md
Add missing rules, fix description contradiction, add standard dirs

**Phase 3: Fix broken skill references**
Files: debugging/SKILL.md, implement/SKILL.md
Remove references to nonexistent skills (team-debug, tdd, verification-before-completion, finishing-branch) or create stubs

**Phase 4: Description quality pass**
Files: compress-prompt, git-surgeon, graphite, reference-sync, implement SKILL.md
Add WHAT + WHEN + triggers to descriptions

**Phase 5: Cleanup and normalization**
Files: pr-fix-gha, fix, multiple
Remove redundant frontmatter, fix numbering, normalize allowed-tools syntax, add error handling

**Phase 6: Progressive disclosure for long skills**
Files: review, pr-reviewers SKILL.md + new references/ dirs
Move detailed prompts/algorithms to references/
